alert.note: Alert for Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 19 at 4:19PM EST until January 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Locally very heavy lake effect snow expected. Additional snow accumulations tonight in excess of 6 inches expected in parts of northern Porter County. * WHERE...Porter County. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...For portions of northern Porter County, travel is expected to be very dangerous in spots tonight under the most intense lake effect band. Peak snowfall rates in excess of 2 inches per hour are likely. Unnecessary travel should be avoided over northern Porter County tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Due to the nature of lake effect snow, conditions can vary significantly over very short distances, going from flurries to white out conditions over the span of just a few miles. This can also result in highly variable snowfall totals over short distances.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Indiana are available by calling 1- 800-261-7623.
